metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12900 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Several protocol parsers in tcpdump before 4.9.2 could cause a buffer over-read in util-print.c:tok2strbuf().

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.9.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
